decks.notes: The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and card advantage by playing multiple Elves creatures, utilizing cards like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid. The key strategy is to quickly ramp into powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth or Archon of Valor's Reach using cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Reclamation Sage and Scavenging Ooze to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence and finish them off with a powerful combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By using creatures like Mother of Runes and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells while deploying threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure. The inclusion of Green Sun's Zenith allows for versatile creature tutoring, while powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords provide additional reach and utility. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient creature beats and disruption.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by playing powerful creatures and using disruptive spells, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes a combination of taxing effects, protection spells, and efficient creature removal to control the board. The deck's mana denial plan is supplemented by land destruction spells and creature abilities that bounce or lock down opponent's lands. By taxing the opponent's resources and keeping their options limited, this deck aims to control the game and win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board while generating value through the use of creatures with powerful abilities. By utilizing cards like Veteran Explorer and Green Sun's Zenith to ramp and find key creatures, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with targeted removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Assassin's Trophy. The addition of cards like Pernicious Deed and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician offers flexibility in dealing with different types of threats, while cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Sword of Fire and Ice provide additional win conditions. Ultimately, the deck emphasizes resource management and outvaluing the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, along with disruptive spells such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. It also utilizes versatile creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure while maintaining card advantage. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, it has access to powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan. The deck also includes land disruption with cards like Wasteland and utility with spells like Kolaghan's Command and Wrenn and Six.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with cards like Baleful Strix and Fatal Push. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage from Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils, and to maintain control of the game through counter spells like Force of Will. The inclusion of versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command and Liliana's Triumph allows the deck to adapt to various situations and keep the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist, supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Counterspells to control the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to utilize its mana efficiently with cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to find threats and answers quickly. By combining pressure with disruption, the deck can maintain tempo and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving Grixis Aggro an edge in resource denial.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also setting up powerful combos like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It aims to grind out value through Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire, while also using cards like Crop Rotation and Gamble to find key pieces. The deck has a strong land denial aspect with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also providing defensive options with cards like Glacial Chasm and Maze of Ith. Additionally, the deck can generate card advantage with Sylvan Library and Wrenn and Six.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to establish early board presence and control through cheap, efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze while utilizing powerful aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Delver of Secrets. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with countermagic and removal spells, while applying pressure with efficient threats. The mana base is focused on fetching essential colors of mana and disrupting opponents' mana base with Wasteland. Overall, the deck prioritizes a fast, proactive gameplay style with a balance of control elements.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through the use of elves and Gaea's Cradle to power out powerful combo cards like Natural Order and Craterhoof Behemoth. Cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote help to draw through the deck and keep the engine running smoothly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence and finish them off with a single massive attack, utilizing cards like Archon of Valor's Reach to lock out potential answers from the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, along with disruptive equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure through creatures like Flickerwisp and Mirran Crusader. The deck also includes cards like Mother of Runes and Palace Jailer for protection and removal, creating a versatile and aggressive strategy that can control the board and win through combat damage. Additionally, cards like Aether Vial and Karakas provide additional utility and flexibility in gameplay.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the game by managing resources and manipulating the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of powerful spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares provide additional protection and removal, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to ensure consistency and card selection. The deck also includes a solid mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to support its control strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It includes various ways to tutor for or protect the combo pieces, such as Crop Rotation and Pithing Needle. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, as well as countermagic like Stifle. Despite being a combo deck, it also includes some elements of control with cards like Wasteland and Sylvan Scrying to help protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Legacy Aggro - Death's Shadow deck focuses on quickly using life as a resource to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting opponents with counters and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board with cheap removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember while applying early pressure with Delver of Secrets. Utilizing a combination of fast mana sources and efficient threats, this deck aims to win the game in the early turns by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing enchantments to create a powerful engine, drawing cards and ramping mana with cards like Enchantress's Presence and Wild Growth. The core strategy revolves around generating value from enchantments while stalling the opponent using cards like Elephant Grass and Solitary Confinement. The inclusion of Living Wish allows for flexibility in accessing sideboard options, while the presence of Serra's Sanctum and Mirri's Guile provide additional synergy and consistency. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage and potent combo plays.

The deck focuses on using the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It includes various land ramp and control cards to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Key cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Library, and Thoughtseize help to set up and maintain the combo, while cards like Dark Confidant and Hymn to Tourach provide card advantage and disruption. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.
